dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5462 IH: To amend the Federal Meat Inspection Act and the Poultry Products Inspection Act to require that the slaughter date, package date, freeze date, and country of origin be labeled on meat and poultry products.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Santos introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Meat Inspection Act and the Poultry Products Inspection Act to require that the slaughter date, package date, freeze date, and country of origin be labeled on meat and poultry products.

section.header: Mandatory labeling requirements for meat and poultry

subsection.text: Section 1(n) of the Federal Meat Inspection Act (21 U.S.C. 601(n)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (11), by striking or at the end;
in paragraph (12), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
if it fails to bear, directly thereon or on its container, as the Secretary may by regulations prescribe—

subparagraph.text: if the country of origin is the United States, the State of origin.

subsection.text: Section 4(h) of the Poultry Products Inspection Act (21 U.S.C. 453(h)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (11), by striking or at the end;
in paragraph (12), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
if it fails to bear, directly thereon or on its container, as the Secretary may by regulations prescribe—

subparagraph.text: if the country of origin is the United States, the State of origin.
